clinical_study.brief_title: A Prospective Study of Application of Platelet Mapping in HBV-related Acute-on-chronic-liver Failure in China
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study of Application of Platelet Mapping in HBV-related Acute-on-chronic-liver Failure in China

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Ineffective hemostasis or a paradoxical prothrombotic state of Acute-on-chronic liver disease (ACLF) has been well established. Thrombelastography measures the dynamics of thrombin production and provides a global assessment of coagulation incorporating the cumulative effect of the interactions at various levels between plasma components and cellular component of coagulation. And through the platelet mapping, it can help provide a picture of patients' function of platelet. This study aims to explore the predictive role of platelet mapping in ACLF prognosis, organ failure developments and short term mortality.
